header_summary: Gloria Zhao announced the release of Bitcoin Core version 29.0, introducing several enhancements, performance improvements, and bug fixes, alongside updated translations and adjustments in P2P and network configurations. This version also brings RPC and REST API updates, configuration changes, and a transition to CMake in the build system, with detailed instructions available at [bitcoincore.org](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-29.0/) and [CMake documentation](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/). A pull request challenging the moderation guidelines within the Bitcoin Core metadata repository sparked a debate on governance, emphasizing decentralized development and collective ownership principles, as discussed by ariard and referenced in historical and legal contexts at [delvingbitcoin.org](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/some-problems-with-current-bitcoin-core-moderation-md/1616). Meanwhile, discussions by sipa and sjors focused on optimizing Bitcoin functionalities, exploring the strengths and challenges of the SFL algorithm compared to others for linearization processes and highlighting performance improvements in `MuHash` with potential for further enhancements, as detailed in their respective threads at [delvingbitcoin.org](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/spanning-forest-cluster-linearization/1419/3) and [delvingbitcoin.org](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/swiftsync-speeding-up-ibd-with-pre-generated-hints-poc/1562/12).

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 29.0 Released
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version 29.0 has been released with features, improvements, and bug fixes.
- Upgrade process and compatibility vary by operating system, with direct upgrades from EOL versions supported.
- Significant changes include network configuration adjustments, mining fixes, RPC and REST API updates, and a build system transition to CMake.

recent_posts.title: Some problems with current bitcoin core `MODERATION.md`
recent_posts.summary:
- A proposal challenges Bitcoin Core moderation guidelines, citing a need for decentralized governance.
- Legal arguments, including the Berne Convention, question the representativeness of acknowledged guidelines.
- The enforcement of current moderation policies is debated for possibly conflicting with community values.

recent_posts.title: Spanning-forest cluster linearization
recent_posts.summary:
- The SFL algorithm's termination guarantees optimal linearization but its consistency is uncertain.
- SFL's complexity is high; strategies to manage it include considering spanning forests.
- Potential improvements and challenges in chunk splitting and state merging need further research.

recent_posts.title: SwiftSync -- Speeding up IBD with pre-generated hints (PoC)
recent_posts.summary:
- The email focuses on improving Bitcoin's SwiftSync and `MuHash` functionalities.
- SwiftSync is preferred for its fewer assumptions, suggesting its integration with `-reindex`.
- Discussions on `MuHash` highlight performance boosts and future optimization potential.

active_posts.title: Post Quantum Signatures and Scaling Bitcoin
active_posts.summary:
- Brandon Black's email argues for Bitcoin's urgent need to adopt Post-Quantum (PQ) signatures.
- Proposed solutions like NTC or NIWA could compress transaction data, using quantum-resistant STARKs.
- Despite potential benefits, concerns about computational costs and centralization of block production remain.

active_posts.title: Relax OP_RETURN standardness restrictions
active_posts.summary:
- Standardness rules in Bitcoin Core aim to prevent DoS attacks, ease upgrades, and discourage harmful practices.
- The Citrea bridge uses Taproot to sidestep OP_RETURN restrictions, embedding data creatively.
- Proposals suggest removing OP_RETURN size and quantity limits to prevent promoting undesirable methods.

active_posts.title: DahLIAS: Discrete Logarithm-Based Interactive Aggregate Signatures
active_posts.summary:
- DahLIAS introduces a first interactive aggregate signature scheme for secp256k1 with 64-byte signatures.
- It facilitates Cross-Input Signature Aggregation (CISA) to reduce transaction sizes and verification costs.
- DahLIAS signatures offer operational efficiency and enhanced security without relying on key tweaking.

active_posts.title: Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary:
- The analysis proposes improvements to Bitcoin's protocol, addressing security and efficiency issues.
- It suggests solutions for the timewarp vulnerability and non-SegWit transaction risks.
- Community debate surrounds the proposal, especially the suggestion to reduce block size.

active_posts.title: How to linearize your cluster
active_posts.summary:
- Optimizing cryptocurrency transaction clusters requires efficient linearization and advanced sorting algorithms.
- Advanced strategies include bottleneck splitting and iterative search for high-feerate subsets, improving processing efficiency.
- Caching and 'jump ahead' techniques in algorithm design streamline transactions, with current implementations showing practical benefits.

active_posts.title: OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY and its amount semantic
active_posts.summary:
- The `OP_CCV` draft enhances Bitcoin UTXOs with data, rules, and coins, supporting P2TR.
- It offers flexible transaction amount options, integrating script and amount logic efficiently.
- Community feedback is vital for refining `OP_CCV`, advancing Bitcoin's scripting capabilities.

today_in_history_posts.title: Proposed BIP editor: Kalle Alm
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Luke Dashjr proposes Kalle Alm as a new BIP editor for merging pull requests.
- He suggests following BIP 2's Process for BIP progression due to no specific editor addition process.
- Luke invites objections to his proposal, reinforcing the practice of editors appointing successors.

today_in_history_posts.title: Increase channel-jamming capital requirements by not counting dust HTLCs
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Eugene proposes increasing capital for channel-jamming attacks to deter low-capital attackers.
- He suggests trimming dust HTLC outputs to maintain non-dust transaction throughput.
- Eugene invites feedback on his proposal to adjust capital requirements and HTLC handling.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Passive investment involves acquiring assets with minimal involvement, like land or shares.
- Active investment engages in asset development and management, generating profit through involvement.
- The blog discusses economic implications of passive vs. active investing and explores stabilizing economies with inflationary currencies backed by deflationary ones like Bitcoin.
